subject: Marketing
title: Post-Purchase Rationalization
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Post-Purchase Rationalization.

hook.text: You buy an expensive jacket and immediately start explaining why it was a smart purchase.

buildup.text: The brain doesn't like feeling wrong. After a purchase, it invents reasons to feel right.

discovery.text: This is cognitive dissonance reduction. We rewrite the story to match the decision.

twist.text: It's why car buyers read glowing reviews after purchasing, not before.

climax.text: Brands that reinforce the choice post-purchaseâ€”thank-you emails, unboxingâ€”boost satisfaction.

punchline.text: People don't buy then believe. They buy then justify.

quiz.question: What is post-purchase rationalization?
options: Inventing reasons to feel good about a purchase already made
Returning products after reading negative reviews
